path.description: Path to a module in the modules database that will be invoked via xdmp.invoke

when.description: When the processor should be invoked. Only 'beforeContentPersisted' is supported.

vars.description: Any properties defined in this object are passed to the invoked module

threadCount.description: If set, overrides the threadCount defined at the flow level and in the step definition

batchSize.description: If set, overrides the batchSize defined at the flow level and in the step definition

stepId.description: This is generated on the server-side

headers.description: Any properties in this object will be copied into the headers of each document processed by the step

additionalSettings.description: Non-DataHub options set by users; used only in UI in custom steps currently

collections.description: additional collections provided by the user that get applied to the step output

additionalCollections.description: default collections associated with a step that are applied to the step output

acceptsBatch.description: If true, the step module is invoked once with all records in the batch passed to it

stepUpdate.description: If true, custom modules can make changes directly to records in the database

provenanceGranularityLevel.description: The granularity of the provenance tracking information: coarse (default) to store document-level provenance information only, fine to store document-level and property-level provenance information, or off to disable provenance tracking in future job runs. Applies only to mapping, matching, merging, mastering, and custom steps.

constrainSourceQueryToJob.description: If true, the query is applied to the documents that were created or modified in the same job that executes the step

sourceQueryIsScript.description: Added in 5.3.0; if true, then sourceQuery can be any JavaScript statement that can be passed into xdmp.eval

sourceQuery.description: Defines the items to be processed by the step; must be a cts.query or cts.uris statement if sourceQueryIsScript is false

excludeAlreadyProcessed.description: Added in 5.4.0; if true, then any items returned by the sourceQuery will be excluded from processing if a Batch document indicates that the item was processed by this step already

targetEntityType.description: The identifier of an Entity Type. (IRI, with title as fallback)
